page.title: 02LANDSCAPE AND ECOLOGY
page.content: Geologically,the area consists of middle and upper limestone topped with oolite on high ground.Ample supply of springs provides part of City water supply.Fertile calcareous clay in valley is good for garden nurseries and market gardening. Steep slopes and large patches of woodland and scrub. The soil is thin on high ground and 25 acres around {Little Solsbury Hill}are not enclosed. Nearly 3000{trees}planted in 1972 at {Mountain Hill,Bathford}to replace felled specimens - 400 Scots Pine,1200 Beech and 1200 Japanese Larch.Hazel, Horsechestnut,Willow and Elder trees abound in area.{Butterflies}in area include whites and sulphurs,blues, skippers,coppers, hairstreaks,browns, admirals and fritillaries.Clover,blueb ells,buttercups,dandelions and celandine abound in the{flower}world.
